name: Pasta Primavera with Cauliflower Sauce
author: EatAndRun
summary: If you're not using a high-protein pasta, you can double the protein per serving by adding 8 ounces cooked and sliced chicken breast. Double the sauce in Step 1 to keep the dish creamy.
ingredients: ½ cup finely shredded Parmesan cheese, plus more for garnish
4 cups broccoli florets, cut into 1-inch pieces
1  red bell pepper, cut into bite-size strips
directions: Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium heat
Add onion and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender, 3 to 4 minutes
Stir in cauliflower and broth; bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer, covered, until tender, about 15 minutes
Add cheese, water, and black pepper
Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions, adding broccoli and bell pepper the last 5 minutes
Return pasta mixture to pot and stir in cauliflower sauce
Heat through, stirring in reserved cooking water (if needed) to reach desired consistency
Garnish with basil, zest (if using), lemon juice, and additional cheese
